credit_line: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
title: Triumphal Arch with the Royal Swedish Coat of Arms
provenance: Hippolyte Destailleur (sold, Paris, May 19, l896, no. 541, ); Leon Decloux (acquired after l906)
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, watercolor, over graphite, ruled border in pen and black ink, green wash on paper
description: The triumphal arch, depicted at center, in mid-distance, consists of a higher central and two lower lateral archways.  Above the central arch is a chariot with two allegorical women. On the ground, seven small-scale men and a woman (and even one accompanying dog) promenade below the arch, pointing or looking at it.
name: Drawing
